00054 /** 
00055  *  @defgroup ro_spi  SPI for Gyros
00056  *  @code #include <gyro_spi.h> @endcode
00057  * 
00058  *  @brief Code for accessing the Gyroscopes
00059  *
00060  * 
00061  *      These are the functions for initializing and using the SPI-
00062  *  Interface. Please be aware, that the Code currently is 
00063  *  optimized for use with the Gyroscopes. One will need to modify
00064  *  it for reusing with other purpose.
00065  *  
00066  *  @note Based on Atmel Datasheet for Atmega128, Nov. 2006
00067  *  @author Rainer Ostendorf
00068  */
00069 
00070 /**@{*/
00071 
00072 
00073 #ifndef GYRO_SPI_H_
00074 #define GYRO_SPI_H_
00075 
00076 #include <inttypes.h>
00077 
00078 /** set this define to read gyrosope 1 only */ 
00079 //#define READ_GYRO1_ONLY 1
00080 
00081 /** chipselect for gyro1 */
00082 #define CS_GYRO1 0
00083 /** chipselect for gyro2 */
00084 #define CS_GYRO2 2 
00085 
00086 /** Din of Gyro for Acc:  0b1000 0011 0000 0000 = 0x8300 */
00087 /** high-byte of "read acceleration" control word for ADIS16100 */
00088 #define ACC_HB 0x83 
00089 /** low-byte of "read acceleration" control word for ADIS16100  -> 2's complement */
00090 #define ACC_LB 0x00 
00091 /** Din of Gyro for Temp:  0b1000 0111 0000 0000 = 0x8700 */
00092 /** high-byte of "read tempereature" control word for ADIS16100 */
00093 #define TEMP_HB 0x87 
00094 /** low-byte of "read tempereature" control word for ADIS16100 */
00095 #define TEMP_LB 0x00 
00096 
00097 /** state definition for the finite state maschine running inside the SPI-ISR */ 
00098 typedef enum gyro_fsm_state_enum {
00099                 /** first run of the ISR, not initialized */
00100                 first_run,
00101                 /** high-byte of "read-acceleration" word was send to gyro 1 */  
00102                 g1_hacc,
00103                 /** low-byte of "read-acceleration" word was send to gyro 1 */ 
00104                 g1_lacc,
00105                 /** high-byte of "read-acceleration" word was send to gyro 2 */
00106                 g2_hacc,
00107                 /** low-byte of "read-acceleration" word was send to gyro1 */
00108                 g2_lacc,
00109                 /** high-byte of "read-temperature" word was send to gyro1 */   
00110                 g1_htmp,
00111                 /** low-byte of "read-temperature" word was send to gyro1 */
00112                 g1_ltmp,
00113                 /** high-byte of "read-temperature" word was send to gyro2 */
00114                 g2_htmp,
00115                 /** high-byte of "read-temperature" word was send to gyro2 */
00116                 g2_ltmp 
00117 } gyro_fsm_state;
00118 
00119 /** the state variable for the ISRs finite state maschine */ 
00120 gyro_fsm_state gyro_state;
00121 
00122 /**Initialize the onboard SPInterface to match the needs
00123  * of the AD ADIS16100 Gyroskope. This means setting the clock,
00124  * setting the ports directions, setting mode etc.
00125  * @param interrupt_mode flag wether to enable the interrupt mode.
00126  *                      In irq-mode, the ISR takes care of reading the Gyros
00127  *                      as fast as possible and fills a global array used as 
00128  *                      ringbuffer of sample-values. Either the Gyros have
00129  *                      to be read manually by calling the spi_write-functions.
00130  */
00131  extern void init_spi_gyro( uint8_t interrupt_mode );
00132  
00133  /** choose a chip by setting the CS1 and CS2 signal
00134   * towards the GAL according
00135   * @param chip Nr of the /CS-Signal to choose (0-3)
00136   */
00137  void spi_cs( uint8_t chip );
00138  
00139  /** @brief Transfer 1 Byte given in data via the SPI
00140   * return the 1 Byte sampled during transfer.
00141   * @param data 8bit word that is transferred
00142   * @return data sampled during transfer
00143   */  
00144  uint8_t spi_write_8( uint8_t data );
00145  
00146   /* @brief Transfer 1 Byte given in data via the SPI, no chipselection
00147   * Returns the 1 Byte sampled during transfer.
00148   * DOES NOT switch CS
00149   * @param data 8bit word that is transferred
00150   * @return data sampled during transfer
00151   */  
00152  uint8_t spi_write_8_nocs( uint8_t data );
00153  
00154  
00155  /** @brief Tranfer 2 Bytes given in data via the SPI,
00156   * return the 2 Bytes sampled during transfer.
00157   * @param data 16bit word that is transferred
00158   * @return data sampled during transfer
00159   */  
00160  uint16_t spi_write_16( uint16_t data );
00161  
00162  /* @brief Transfer 2 Bytes given in data via the SPI, no chipselection
00163   * return the 2 Bytes sampled during transfer.
00164   * DO NOT switch CS
00165   * @param data 16bit word that is transferred
00166   * @return data sampled during transfer
00167   */  
00168  uint16_t spi_write_16_nocs( uint16_t data );
00169 
00170 #endif /*GYRO_SPI_H_*/
00171 
00172 /**@}*/
